path: books/Category Theory For Programmers/15. The Yoneda Lemma/1

attr.a:
let `psiâ fa = (flip fmap) fa` so `psi` and `phi`âs each input/output type match. (flip swaps the order of parameters)

```haskell
phi (psiâ fa)
= (psiâ fa) id
= ((flip fmap) fa) id
= fmap id fa
= fa
```
attr.q:
Show that the two functions `phi` and `psi` that form the Yoneda isomorphism in Haskell are inverses of each other.

```haskell
phi :: (forall x . (a -> x) -> F x) -> F a
phi alpha = alpha id
```

```haskell
psi :: F a -> (forall x . (a -> x) -> F x)
psi fa h = fmap h fa
```
